definition: to support/to prop up/to push or move with a pole/to maintain/to open or unfurl/to fill to bursting point/brace/stay/support

sentences.english: Without strong government backing, the private sector was loth to fork out.
sentences.chinese: 没了政府撑腰，私人企业掏起钱来心不甘情不愿。

sentences.english: Iraq shares a table, before is always bullied by Iraq, has class leader to support luckily.
sentences.chinese: 伊拉克同桌，以前老被伊拉克欺负，幸好有班长撑腰。

sentences.english: Now that they were backed up, these fellows became audacious in the extreme.
sentences.chinese: 一旦有人撑腰，这帮家伙就变得胆大包天。

sentences.english: Many of these markets are operating only because the government is propping them up.
sentences.chinese: 仅仅只是因为政府在撑腰，许多这样的市场还在维持。

sentences.english: The military-backed government has heavily censored the news.
sentences.chinese: 有军方撑腰的政府对新闻进行了严格审查。

sentences.english: The lady is forever so good to elder sister of vegetable Yun, will definitely give assist as her.
sentences.chinese: 夫人一直对素芸姐姐这么好，一定会为她撑腰的。

definition: lit. to hide the sky with one hand/to hide the truth from the masses
to offend sb/to give offense/to displease
protective umbrella/fig. person affording protection (esp. corrupt)
to signal the musicians (in Chinese opera, by prolonging a spoken word before attacking a song)/(coll.) to challenge
secure in the knowledge that one has backing
to show deference to sb by obliging them (or by obliging sb associated with them)
to adopt confrontational posture/to meet head-on/to compete
